rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:17): sdumitriu: ping  
sdumitriu - (05/08/2009 18:17): Hi rrodriguez  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:18): Hi! Once outputSyntax is out with 2.0m2, I would like to regain access to http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2018  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:18): please, could you provide an example of an http client supporting basic authentication?  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:19): sorry if the question is too basic!  
sdumitriu - (05/08/2009 18:20): What kind of client?  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:22): as far as I understand, it not possible yet to pass username and password with an URL from, let's say Firefox  
sdumitriu - (05/08/2009 18:22): http://hc.apache.org/httpclient-3.x/authentication.html#Server\_Authentication  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:22): so, please, what kind of http clients are able to access XWiki using basic authentication?  
sdumitriu - (05/08/2009 18:22): Indeed, it's not possible that way  
sdumitriu - (05/08/2009 18:23): Again, what do you understand by clients?  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:23): ok, that is the problem: my own understanding of "client" :-(  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:23): I think I get the point now  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:24): It is planned to have this possibility in the future?  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:25): Again, I am working with R. R is calling some code stored in XWiki  
sdumitriu - (05/08/2009 18:25): HTTP client = any thing that can make HTTP request: rss readers, console apps like wget, full browsers like Firefox...  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:25): source() in R is the client then  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:25): I've to find some more information about it  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:25): Then, I will come back on this issue.  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:26): Thanks for your help!  
rrodriguez - (05/08/2009 18:26): in any case, please, it is planned to be able to pass username and passwords with an URL?
